utilx

Class Prompt

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilx.Prompt

  • public final class Prompt
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows easy prompting and data type verification for user input

    Examples

    Integer iValue = Prompt.getInt("Enter a number between 0 and 50", 0, 50);
    // iValue is now an Integer between 0 and 50 (or null if using dialogs and the user canceled)

    String strName = Prompt.getString("Enter your name: ");
    // strName is now a String (or null if using dialogs and the user canceled)

    New in 3.0

    • Formatted the documentation to be easier to read
    • Reduced the number of method calls done by methods with overloads
    • Fixed an incorrect error message on Prompt.getString(...)
    • Added length to the StringBuilder used internally
    • Added Prompt.getMatch(...)
    • Added Prompt.setAllowNull(Boolean)
    • Added Prompt.getAllowNull()
    • Renamed Prompt.isUsingDialogs() to Prompt.getUseDialogs()
    • Removed Prompt.getBoolean(...)
    • Removed Prompt.getChar(String strMsg, int iIndex)
    • Removed Prompt.showMessage(...)
    • Removed Prompt.toggleDialogs()
    • Removed Prompt.useDialogs()
    • Removed Prompt.usingDialogs()
